Ramsey Number

DM
Dec 12, 2020
$R(m, n)$ where $m$ and $n$ are positive integers tells the minimum number of people at party such that their are $m$ mutual friends or $n$ mutual enemies.

Binomial Distribution

DM
Nov 30, 2020

Bernoulli Trials

DM
Nov 29, 2020
Each performance of Experiment with two possible outcomes is called a Bernoulli Trial named after James Bernoulli.

Mutually Independent Events

DM
Nov 28, 2020
Events $E_1, E_2, \dots E_n$ are mutually independent if $p(E_{i_1} \cap E_{i_2} \dots \cap E_{i_m}) = p(E_{i_1})p(E_{i_2}) \dots p(E_{i_m})$ for $i_j, j = 1, 2, \dots m$ for $1 \le i_1 < i_2 \dots < i_m \le n$ and $m \ge 2$.

Pairwise Independent Events

DM
Nov 27, 2020
Events $E_1, E_2, \dots E_n$ are pairwise independent if $p(E_i \cap E_j) = p(E_i)p(E_j)$ for $1 \le i < j \le n$.

Independent Events

DM
Nov 26, 2020
Two events $E$ and $F$ are independent iff $p(E \cap F) = p(E)p(F)$

Nov 25, 2020
Let $E$ and $F$ be two events such that outcome of $E$ depends on outcome of $F$ and $p(F)>0$ then conditional probability ($p(E | F)$) is

Nov 20, 2020

FInite Probability

DM
Nov 16, 2020
If $S$ is a finite nonempty Sample Space and $E$ is an Event from that sample space then probability of $E$ is $p(E) = {|E| \over |S|}$.

Division Algorithm

DM
Nov 5, 2020

Counting

DM

Pigeonhole Principle

DM
Oct 6, 2020
If $k>0$ and $k+1$ objects are placed in $k$ boxes then at least one box will have more than one objects.

Subsequence

DM
Oct 5, 2020
A subsequence of a sequence $a_1, a_2 \dots a_n$ is of form $a_{i_1}, a_{i_2} \dots a_{i_m}$ where $1 \le i_1 \le i_2 \dots \le i_m \le N$.

Generalized Pigeonhole Principle

DM
Oct 4, 2020
If $N$ objects are placed in $k$ boxes then there is at least one box containing at least $\lceil {N \over k} \rceil$ objects.

Tree Diagrams

DM
Oct 3, 2020
Tree could be used to solve counting problems by mapping decisions/outcomes on each branch.

Division Rule

DM
Oct 2, 2020
If there are $n/d$ ways to do a task then the procedure could be done in $n$ ways where each way $w$ exactly $d$ of $n$ ways correspond to $w$.

Subtraction Rule

DM
Oct 1, 2020

Product Rule

DM
Sep 30, 2020

Sum Rule

DM
Sep 29, 2020
If a task could be done in either $n_1$ or $n_2$ ways and $n_1 \cap n_2 = \varnothing$ then there are $n_1 + n_2$ ways to do the task.

Lame's Theorem

DM
Sep 2, 2020
Given $a$ and $b$ are positive integers with $a \ge b$. Then number of divisions done by Euclidean Algorithm to find Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of $a$ and $b$ is $5\ \times$ the number of decimal digits in $b$.

Strong Induction

DM
Aug 19, 2020
The basis step of Strong Induction is same as Principle of Mathematical Induction but for inductive hypothesis we assume that $P(j)$ is true for all $j = 1, 2, \dots k$.

Bzout Theorem

DM
Aug 18, 2020

Greatest Common Divisor (GCD)

DM
Aug 17, 2020
Let $a$ and $b$ be two integers such that $a, b \neq 0$.

Least Common Multiple (LCM)

DM
Aug 16, 2020
LCM of two positive integers $a$ and $b$ is smallest integers $k$ such that $a | k$ and $b | k$. It is denoted as $lcm(a, b)$.

Primes

DM
Aug 15, 2020
It is an integer greater than 1 that is not divisible by any positive integer other than 1 and itself.

Prime Factorization

DM
Aug 14, 2020
When an integer $a$ is written in form $a = p_1^{a_1}p_2^{a_2} \dots p_n^{a_n}$. Here $p$ is a prime number.

Relatively Prime

DM
Aug 13, 2020
Integers $a_1, a_2, \dots a_n$ are pairwise relatively prime if $gcd(a_i, a_j)=1$ and $1 \le i < j \le n$.

Cunningham Numbers

DM
Aug 12, 2020
Numbers of form $k^n \pm 1$ where $k$ is a small positive integer and $n$ is a large positive integer.

Infinitude of Primes

DM
Aug 7, 2020
If we have $p_1, p_2, \dots p_n$ prime numbers there always exist a prime number greater than $p_n$. Simply, there are infinite prime numbers.

Divisibility

DM
Jul 23, 2020
If $a$ and $b$ are integers then we say *$a$ divides $b$* if there exists an integer $c$ such that $b=ac$ and $b \over a$ is an integer.

Boolean Product

DM
Jul 21, 2020
Let $A=[a_{ij}]$ and $B=[b_{ij}]$ be two matrices of order $m \times k$ and $k \times n$ respectively. Then boolean product $A \odot B$ will be $A \odot B =[c_{ij}]$

Symmetric Matrix

DM

DM
Jul 15, 2020

Schrder-Bernstein Theorem

DM
Jul 7, 2020
If $|A| \le |B|$ and $|B| \le |A|$ then $|A| = |B|$.

Cantor Diagonalization Argument

DM
Jul 5, 2020
To prove that a set of positive rational numbers is Countable, we first arrange the numbers such that numbers with denominator 1 are listed in first row, denominator 2 are listed in second row and so on.

Partial Functions

DM
Jun 19, 2020
For a partial function $f$ is an assignment of a unique element $a$ (in a subset of Domain of $A$ called domain of definition) to a unique element $b \in B$.

Functions

DM
Jun 18, 2020
Given two nonempty Sets $A$ and $B$. A function $f$ from $A$ to $B$ is assignment of a single element of $B$ to each element in $A$.

DM
Jun 16, 2020

Bijection

DM
Jun 9, 2020

Onto Functions

DM
Jun 8, 2020
A function is called onto or surjection if for every element $b \in B$ there is an element $a \in A$ with $f(a)=b$. Function is called sujective.

One-to-One Functions

DM
Jun 7, 2020
Functions which do not assign same value to two different elements in Domain.

Strictly Decreasing Functions

DM
Jun 6, 2020
A function $f$ whose Domain and Codomain are Subsets of real numbers is called strictly decreasing function if $f(x) > f(y)$ whenever $x > y$

Decreasing Functions

DM
Jun 5, 2020
A function $f$ whose Domain and Codomain are Subsets of real numbers is called decreasing function if $f(x) \geq f(y)$ whenever $x > y$

Strictly Increasing Functions

DM
Jun 4, 2020
A function $f$ whose Domain and Codomain are Subsets of real numbers is called strictly increasing function if $f(x) < f(y)$ whenever $x < y$

Increasing Functions

DM
Jun 3, 2020
A function $f$ whose Domain and Codomain are Subsets of real numbers is called increasing function if $f(x) \leq f(y)$ whenever $x < y$

May 19, 2020

Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion

Truth Set

DM
May 10, 2020

Power Set

DM
May 5, 2020
Power set of set $S$ is the set of all subsets of $S$.

Proper Subset

DM
May 4, 2020
We write set $A$ as proper subset of set $B$ (notation $A \subset B$). If $A$ is a subset of $B$ and there is an element of $B$ not present in $A$.

Subsets

DM
May 3, 2020
Set $A$ is subset of set $B$ if and only if every element of set $A$ is present in set $B$.

Fermat's Last Theorem

DM
Apr 24, 2020
The equation $x^n + y^n = z^n$ has no solution when $xyz \neq 0$ when $n >2$.

Proof Methods and Strategies

DM
Apr 23, 2020

Backward Reasoning

DM
Apr 22, 2020
To reason backward and prove a statement $q$ we find a statement $p$ such that $p \to q$.

Forward Reasoning

DM
Apr 21, 2020
You start with the Premises, then by using Axioms and known Theorem by a series of steps you reach Conclusion.

DM
Apr 20, 2020
Proofs that assert a Theorem about a particular element with specific properties.

DM
Apr 19, 2020
When we can't find an element $a$ for which $P(a)$ is true.

Existence Proofs

DM
Apr 18, 2020
Proof of a Proposition of type $\exists xP(x)$ where $P(x)$ is a Predicates is called existence proof. It is done to assert that object of a particular type exists.

Constructive Proofs

DM
Apr 17, 2020
We can find an element $a$ for which $P(a)$ is true, that element will be called witness.

Without Loss of Generality (WLOG)

DM
Apr 16, 2020
This statement is used to assert that by proving one case of a Theorem there's no need to prove another specified Arguments.

Proof by Cases

DM
Apr 15, 2020
When a Theorem is proved by examining it on all possible cases.

Proof by Cases Tautology

DM
Apr 14, 2020
$$[(p_1, p_2, \dots, p_n) \to q] \leftrightarrow [(p_1 \to q) \wedge (p_2 \to q) \wedge] \dots (p_n \to q)$$

Exhaustive Proofs

DM
Apr 13, 2020
When Theorem are proved by examining a relatively small number of cases.

Proofs

DM
Apr 12, 2020
Proofs are really important in Computer Science they are used to verify if a computer program produces valid output for all sets of inputs.

Proofs of Equivalence

DM
Apr 11, 2020
To prove a Biconditional statement $p \leftrightarrow q$ we have to prove that both statements $p \to q$ and $q \to p$ are true.

Proofs by Contradiction

DM
Apr 10, 2020
We want to prove that Conditional Statement $p \to q$ is true.

Indirect Proofs

DM
Apr 9, 2020

Trivial Proofs

DM
Apr 8, 2020
If we know $q$ is true in Conditional Statement $p \to q$. Then we can also say that $p \to q$ is also true. This is called Trivial Proof.

Proofs by Contraposition

DM
Apr 7, 2020
Contrapositive of Conditional Statement $p \to q$ will be Equivalent to original statement. So proving the contrapositive ($\neg q \to \neg p$) will also prove original conditional statement.

Vacuous Proofs

DM
Apr 6, 2020
We know that $p \to q$ is true when $p$ is false.

Direct Proofs

DM
Apr 5, 2020
A direct proof of Conditional Statement $p \to q$ starts with Hypothesis that $p$ is true, after that Rules of Inference are applied to reach Conclusion that $q$ is also true.

Conjecture

DM
Apr 4, 2020
A statement that is proposed to be true based on some partial evidence or a heuristic Arguments, or the intuition of an expert.

Corollary

DM
Apr 3, 2020
A Theorem that can be established directly from a Theorem that has a Proofs.

Lemma

DM
Apr 2, 2020
Less important Theorem that could be helpful in Proofs of other results.

Axioms

DM
Apr 1, 2020
Statements we assume to be true.

Theorem

DM
Mar 31, 2020
A statement that can be shown to be true.

Informal Proofs

DM
Mar 30, 2020
Can have more than one rule of inference in steps, steps can be skipped and axioms can not be stated explicitly.

Propositional Logic

DM
Mar 29, 2020
Rules of logic give precise meaning to mathematical statements.

Universal Modus Tollens

DM
Mar 28, 2020
It is a combination of Modus Tollens and Universal Instantiation.

Universal Modus Ponens

DM
Mar 27, 2020
It is a combination of Modus Ponens and Universal Instantiation.

Universal Generalization

DM
Mar 26, 2020
Universal Quantifier

Existential Generalization

DM
Mar 25, 2020
Existential Quantifier

Existential Instantiation

DM
Mar 24, 2020
Existential Quantifier

Universal Instantiation

DM
Mar 23, 2020
Universal Quantifier

Rules of Inference of Quantified Statements

DM
Mar 22, 2020

Fallacy of denying the hypothesis

DM
Mar 21, 2020
Proposition $((p \to q) \wedge \neg p) \to \not q$ is not a tautology (when p=False and q=True). But many incorrect arguments treat it like a tautology. This is Fallacy of denying the hypothesis.

Fallacy of affirming the conclusion

DM
Mar 20, 2020
Proposition $((p \to q) \wedge q) \to p$ is not a tautology (when p=False and q=True). But many incorrect arguments treat it like a tautology. This is Fallacy of affirming the conclusion.

Fallacies

DM
Mar 19, 2020
It is incorrect form of reasoning.

Clauses

DM
Mar 18, 2020
Disjunction or Negation of Proposition variables.

Resolution

DM
Mar 17, 2020
$$((p \vee q) \wedge (\neg p \vee r)) \to (q \vee r)$$

Conjunction (Rules of Inference)

DM
Mar 16, 2020
Same as Conjunction.

Simplification

DM
Mar 15, 2020
$$(p \wedge q) \to p$$

Addition

DM
Mar 14, 2020
$$p \to (p \vee q)$$

Disjunctive syllogism

DM
Mar 13, 2020
$$((p \vee q) \wedge \neg p) \to q$$

Hypothetical syllogism

DM
Mar 12, 2020
$$((p \to q) \wedge (q \to r) \to (p \to r))$$

Modus Tollens

DM
Mar 11, 2020
$$(\neg q \wedge (p \to q)) \to \neg (p)$$

Modus Ponens

DM
Mar 10, 2020
Also known as Law of Detachment.

Argument Form

DM
Mar 9, 2020
Series of Compound Propositions containing Propositional Variables.

Arguments

DM
Mar 8, 2020
Series of statements that ends with a Conclusion or a sequence of Proposition.

Valid

DM
Mar 7, 2020
An Arguments is valid only if conclusion follows from the truth of Premises.

Premises

DM
Mar 6, 2020
Statements in argument before conclusion.

Definition of Limits using Quantifiers

DM
Mar 5, 2020
We know from Formal Definition of Limits that for every real number $\epsilon >0$ there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that

Nested Quantifiers

DM
Mar 4, 2020
They could be thought of as a Nested Loop.

Quantifiers

DM
Mar 3, 2020
Quantification is another way to create a Proposition from Propositional Function. It gives a range of values over which a Proposition is true.

Logical Programming

DM
Mar 2, 2020
Prolog was developed in 1970s to reason using rules of predicate.

Logical Equivalence of Quantifiers

DM
Mar 1, 2020
Logical Equivalence of two statements containing Predicates and Quantifiers is true only when they have same truth value

De Morgan Law of Quantifiers

DM
Feb 29, 2020
$$\neg \forall xP(x) \equiv \exists !x \neg P(x)$$

Free

DM
Feb 28, 2020
When there is no value assigned to a Propositional Variables it is free.

Bound

DM
Feb 27, 2020
A Propositional Variables is bound if there is a value assigned to it.

Precedence of Quantifiers

DM
Feb 26, 2020

Quantifiers with restricted domains

DM
Feb 25, 2020
Here, domain over which quantifier is true is specified in the end.

Uniqueness Quantifier

DM
Feb 24, 2020
Uniqueness Quantification of Propositional Function P(x) states that over a particular domain there exists a unique value for which P(x) is true.

Existential Quantifier

DM
Feb 23, 2020
Existential Quantification of Propositional Function P(x) will be true over a particular domain if P(x) is true over any value in that domain.

Universal Quantifier

DM
Feb 22, 2020
Universal Quantification of Propositional Function P(x) over any particular domain asserts that P(x) is true over all values of x in that domain.

Counterexample

DM
Feb 21, 2020
A value in Domain of Discourse that falsifies Universal Quantifier.

Domain of Discourse

DM
Feb 20, 2020
Values over which a (mathematical) property is true.

Predicate Calculus

DM
Feb 19, 2020
Area of logic that deals with Predicates and Quantifiers.

Postconditions

DM
Feb 18, 2020
Statements that describe valid output of a program.

Preconditions

DM
Feb 17, 2020
Statements that describe valid input of a program.

Predicates

DM
Feb 16, 2020
Statements that are neither true nor false until the value of a particular Propositional Variables is specified.

n-ary Predicate

DM
Feb 15, 2020
Multiple Propositional Variables used as input to a Propositional Function.

Propositional Function

DM
Feb 14, 2020
A Proposition represented a function. Takes Propositional Variables as inputs.

Logic Circuits

DM
Feb 13, 2020
Claude Shannon first observed that Propositional Logic could be used to create logic circuits in hardware.

Satisfiability of Sudoku

DM
Feb 12, 2020

Applications of Satisfiability

DM
Feb 11, 2020

Proposition Satisfiability

DM
Feb 10, 2020

Solution

DM
Feb 9, 2020
Set of Truth Value that make a Compound Propositions Satifiable.

Unsatisfiable

DM
Feb 8, 2020
A Compound Propositions is unsatifiable is there is no set of Truth Value for which it is true.

Satifiable

DM
Feb 7, 2020
A Compound Propositions is satifiable if there is a set of Truth Value of its variables that makes it true.

Propositional Equivalences

DM
Feb 6, 2020

Laws defined over compound propositions

DM
Feb 5, 2020

Logical Equivalence

DM
Feb 4, 2020
Compound Propositions that are always equal for all Truth Value. It is denoted as $p \equiv q$.

Contingency

DM
Feb 3, 2020
A Compound Propositions that is neither Tautology nor Contradiction.

Contradiction

DM
Feb 2, 2020
A Compound Propositions that is always false irrespective of its constituent Proposition.

Tautology

DM
Feb 1, 2020
A Compound Propositions that is always true irrespective of the Truth Value of its constituent Proposition.

AND Gate

DM
Jan 31, 2020
Takes two inputs and performs Conjunction.

OR Gate

DM
Jan 30, 2020
Takes two inputs and performs Disjunction.

NOT Gate

DM
Jan 29, 2020
Also known as Inverter.

Logic Puzzles

DM
Jan 28, 2020
Puzzles could also be solved using Propositional Logic.

Boolean Searches

DM
Jan 27, 2020
Propositional Logic is used to create queries for searching in large databases.

System Specifications

DM
Jan 26, 2020
Requirements for Hardware/Software (from English language) could be translated to Propositional Logic to remove ambiguity in statements.

Translating English Senteces

DM
Jan 25, 2020
Sentences from english could be translated using Propositional Logic to remove ambiguity.

Applications of Propositional Logic

DM
Jan 24, 2020

Bitwise Operators

DM
Jan 23, 2020

Bit Operators

DM
Jan 22, 2020
Logical Operators $\wedge, \vee, \oplus$ can have notation as AND, OR, XOR when used as bit operators.

Bit String

DM
Jan 21, 2020
A string of zero or more Bit.

Boolean Variable

DM
Jan 20, 2020
A variable that is either true (or 1) or false (or 0). It can be represented using a Bit.

Bit

DM
Jan 19, 2020
A symbol with two possible values 0 or 1 but not both.

Compound Propositions

DM
Jan 18, 2020
New Proposition formed by applying Logical Operators on existing Proposition.

Logical Operators

DM
Jan 17, 2020
Operations performed on one or more Proposition to create new Proposition.

Biconditional

DM
Jan 16, 2020
For two Proposition p and q, Compound Propositions $p \leftrightarrow q$ is true when both both p and q have same Truth Value false otherwise.

Conditional Statement

DM
Jan 15, 2020
Proposition $p \to q$ pronounced as "if p then q" is false when p is true and q is false and true otherwise.

Inverse

DM
Jan 14, 2020
For proposition $p \to q$, inverse will be $\neg p \to \neg q$.

Contrapositive

DM
Jan 13, 2020
For proposition $p \to q$, contrapositive will be $\neg q \to \neg p$.

Equivalent

DM
Jan 12, 2020
When two Compound Propositions have same Truth Value.

Converse

DM
Jan 11, 2020
For proposition $p \to q$, converse will be $q \to p$.

Exclusive OR

DM
Jan 10, 2020
When either p or q can be true. But in order to satisfy the Proposition both can't be true at same time.

Inclusive OR

DM
Jan 9, 2020
When either p or q and even both can be true to satisfy the Proposition.

Disjunction

DM
Jan 8, 2020
Let p and q be two Proposition. Then disjunction of these two will be $p \vee q$.

Conjunction

DM
Jan 7, 2020
Let p and q be two Proposition. Then $p \wedge q$ will be the conjunction of both.

Truth Table

DM
Jan 6, 2020
Table containing all possible Truth Value of a Proposition.

Negation

DM
Jan 5, 2020
Let p be a Proposition.

Propositional Calculus

DM
Jan 4, 2020
Area that deals with Proposition. Developer by Greek Philosopher Aristotle.

Truth Value

DM
Jan 3, 2020
It is True (or T) when Proposition is true and False (or F) when Proposition is false.

Propositional Variables

DM
Jan 2, 2020
Variables to denote Proposition.

Proposition

DM
Jan 1, 2020
A Declarative sentence (a sentence that declares a fact) that is either true or false but not both.
